title: Paper: Midwifery FQE August 2021
description: Final Qualifying Examination for Diploma in Community Health Nursing (Midwifery) - August 2021

questions.question: The functional part of the breast responsible for milk secretion is the:
questions.explanation: Acini cells (alveoli) are the milk-producing cells. Myoepithelial cells contract to eject milk, and tubules transport it.
questions.hint: The grape-like sacs where milk is made.

questions.question: During embryo development, oral and nasal structures begin to form at:
questions.explanation: Facial development begins around the 4th week of gestation.

questions.question: In a case of Occipito-posterior position during the second stage, palpation of the sagittal suture in the transverse diameter with both fontanelles palpable indicates:
questions.explanation: Deep Transverse Arrest occurs when the head engages but arrests in the transverse position deep in the pelvis, often due to deflexion (making both fontanelles palpable).

questions.question: Which congenital cardiac defects present with cyanosis?

options.text: Patent ductus arteriosus and tricuspid atresia
Fallot’s tetrallogy and ventricular septal defect
Hypoplastic left heart syndrome and aortic stenosis
Great vessels transposition and truncus arteriosus

questions.explanation: Cyanotic defects involve Right-to-Left shunts. Transposition of Great Arteries and Truncus Arteriosus are classic cyanotic lesions.

questions.question: The 1st and 2nd home visits following spontaneous vertex delivery should be accomplished within:
questions.explanation: 1st visit is within 48 hours; 2nd visit is within 1-2 weeks. Both fall within the 0-4 week window.

questions.question: On placenta examination, the characteristics of the chorion membrane include:

options.text: It’s opaque and tough to tear
It’s opaque and easy to tear (friable)

questions.explanation: The Chorion is the outer, rough, opaque membrane attached to the placenta. It is friable (tears easily).

questions.question: In zygote development, the amnion membrane develops from the:
questions.explanation: The Inner Cell Mass forms the embryo and the amnion. The Outer Cell Mass (Trophoblast) forms the chorion and placenta.

questions.question: During labour, the PRIORITY action for the midwife upon noticing variable deceleration of the fetal heart rate is to:

options.text: Rule out the presence of placenta praevia
Administer oxygen to the mother immediately

questions.explanation: Variable decelerations indicate cord compression. Changing maternal position often relieves pressure on the cord.

questions.question: The CORRECT statement about foetal circulation is:

options.text: Ductus venosus conveys deoxygenated blood to the right atrium
Ductus arteriosus conveys oxygenated blood to the right atrium
Foetal haemoglobin is produced by the yolk sac
Most of the blood in the right atrium is diverted to the left atrium via foramen ovale

questions.explanation: Oxygenated blood from the IVC is directed across the right atrium through the foramen ovale into the left atrium.
questions.hint: Right to Left shunt in the heart.

questions.question: Which statement by a postnatal client suggests postpartum depression?

options.text: “I feel like crying for no apparent reason”
“I have been frequently getting a headache”
“I find myself becoming teary-eyed at times”
“I have been feeling restless a lot lately”

questions.explanation: Persistent unprovoked crying and low mood beyond the first few days (Baby Blues) suggest developing depression.

questions.question: An important landmark of the pelvis that determines the distance of the descent of the presenting part is the:
questions.explanation: Station 0 is at the level of the ischial spines.

questions.question: The PRIORITY action for a client with hypotonic uterine contractions intrapartumly is:
questions.explanation: Hypotonic inertia (weak contractions) is treated by augmentation with oxytocin to improve strength and frequency.

questions.question: In the management of the second stage of labour, when the face sweeps the perineum, the midwife should first:

options.text: Clean the face using a soft gauze

questions.explanation: Immediately after the head is born, the midwife checks for a nuchal cord and wipes the face/mouth.

questions.question: The analysis of foetal deaths from 22 weeks gestation up to the first 7 days post-partum is an accurate measure of the:
questions.explanation: Perinatal mortality = Stillbirths + Early Neonatal Deaths (0-7 days).

questions.question: Cord presentation is where the cord lies in front of the presenting part:
questions.explanation: Cord Presentation means the membranes are INTACT. If they rupture, it becomes Cord Prolapse.

questions.question: The reflex response assessed by gently touching the corner of the baby’s mouth is:
questions.explanation: The baby turns toward the touch (rooting) to find the breast.

questions.question: Following normal delivery, after drying and scoring APGAR, the next routine steps are:

options.text: Take birth weight, administer vitamin K
Take neonate to NBU, take birth weight
Take neonate to NBU, give tetracycline eye ointment
Bring neonate for breastfeeding, take neonate to NBU

questions.explanation: Routine care includes weighing and Vitamin K administration. Transfer to NBU is only for sick infants.

questions.question: Icterus gravis and hydrops fetalis are conditions highly associated with:
questions.explanation: Severe Rhesus isoimmunization causes severe hemolysis (Icterus Gravis) and heart failure/edema (Hydrops).

questions.question: Vitamin K prevents haemorrhagic disease of the neonate by:

options.text: Altering the red blood cell count

questions.explanation: Vitamin K is essential for the synthesis/activation of clotting factors II, VII, IX, and X in the liver.

questions.question: Delivery of breech with extended arms is accomplished through:
questions.explanation: Lovset's maneuver rotates the fetus to bring the posterior arm anteriorly for delivery.

questions.question: The first cluster of cells formed after fertilization is known as:
questions.explanation: The zygote cleaves to form a solid ball of cells called the Morula (mulberry).

questions.question: The presenting diameter in brow presentation is:
questions.explanation: Mento-vertical (13.5cm) is the longest diameter and presents in brow presentation.

questions.question: Clinical features of intracranial injury in a newborn include:
questions.explanation: Signs of cerebral irritation include high-pitched cry, irritability, seizures, and abnormal tone (paralysis).

questions.question: In focused antenatal care, the 2nd visit occurs between:
questions.explanation: Standard 4-visit schedule: 1st (<16wks), 2nd (24-28wks), 3rd (32wks), 4th (36wks).

questions.question: The correct management approach for a patient with severe hyperemesis gravidarum is:

options.text: Outpatient care, normal diet & specific drugs
Outpatient care, correct fluid imbalance & normal diet

questions.explanation: Severe hyperemesis requires admission for IV fluids (rehydration) and antiemetics.

questions.question: During the second stage of labour, the breathing technique used when the head is crowning is:
questions.explanation: Blowing or panting prevents pushing during crowning, allowing the head to stretch the perineum slowly.

questions.question: The frequency of uterine contractions is determined by timing from:

options.text: The beginning of one contraction to the beginning of the next
Until the time it is completely over
To the end of a second contraction
Until the time the uterus becomes firm

questions.explanation: Frequency is the start-to-start interval.

questions.question: While providing care to the neonate after birth, which intervention has the HIGHEST PRIORITY?

options.text: Cover the neonate’s head with a cap

questions.explanation: Preventing hypothermia (by covering the head) is a critical immediate priority.

questions.question: Persistent occipitoposterior position is associated with:
questions.explanation: If the occiput remains posterior, the baby is born looking up (Face to Pubis).

questions.question: The PRIORITY management of uncomplicated malaria during the FIRST TRIMESTER includes administration of:
questions.explanation: Quinine is the drug of choice for 1st trimester malaria.

questions.question: A positive Horman’s test in a postpartum client indicates:
questions.explanation: Homan's sign (calf pain on dorsiflexion) suggests DVT.

questions.question: Wiping the neonate dry at birth prevents heat loss via:
questions.explanation: Drying prevents evaporation of amniotic fluid from the skin.

questions.question: To ensure the baby breathes as soon as the head is delivered (if airway is obstructed), the priority is:
questions.explanation: Clearing the airway (suctioning if meconium/obstruction present) allows for the first breath.

questions.question: The normal umbilical cord is composed of:
questions.explanation: Two arteries carry deoxygenated blood; one vein carries oxygenated blood.

questions.question: At what stage of labour does a primigravida differ mainly from a multigravida?
questions.explanation: The first stage (dilation) is significantly longer in primigravidae.

questions.question: A postpartum patient with prolonged labour (30h) and prolonged rupture of membranes (24h) is at risk for:
questions.explanation: Prolonged ROM allows bacteria to ascend, causing infection of the uterine lining (Endometritis).

questions.question: The antidote for heparin complications is:
questions.explanation: Protamine sulfate reverses heparin.

questions.question: Recommended treatment for a client with partial placenta praevia (preterm, no active bleeding) is:
questions.explanation: Conservative management (bed rest) allows the fetus to mature.

questions.question: To prevent breast engorgement, the postpartum client should be advised to:
questions.explanation: Frequent feeding empties the breasts and prevents stasis/engorgement.

questions.question: A client with pregnancy induced hypertension is likely to exhibit:
questions.explanation: Classic triad of severe Pre-eclampsia symptoms: Hypertension, Proteinuria, and Cerebral signs (Headache, Vision changes).
questions.hint: BP effects on brain and kidneys.

questions.question: Match the anatomical labels of a non-pregnant uterus diagram:
questions.explanation: Standard dimensions: 7.5 x 5 x 2.5 cm.

questions.question: State five (5) benefits of breastfeeding to the mother. (Select 5)
questions.explanation: Benefits include involution, reduced bleeding, weight loss, cancer protection, and bonding.
questions.hint: Good for the womb and health.

questions.question: Explain five (5) causes of asphyxia neonatorum. (Select 5)
questions.explanation: Any factor interrupting oxygen delivery (cord, placenta, maternal flow) causes asphyxia.

questions.question: Identify physiological changes prenatally in these systems: CVS, Renal, Skin. (Select correct options)
questions.explanation: Blood volume goes up, Kidneys filter more, Skin gets darker.

questions.question: Outline four (4) objectives of post-natal home visits. (Select 4)
questions.explanation: Objectives: Check mom, check baby, catch problems, teach.

questions.question: What is the evaluation scale used on neonates one minute after birth?
questions.explanation: APGAR: Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration.

questions.question: Explain three (3) elements in Bishop’s score for induction. (Select 3)
questions.explanation: Bishop score evaluates cervical readiness (Dilation, Effacement, Consistency, Position, Station).

questions.question: State four (4) key points a service provider should consider before giving SP (Sulfadoxine Pyrimethamine) to a pregnant woman. (Select 4)
questions.explanation: SP rules: Not in 1st trimester, check allergies, no Septrin, spaced doses.

questions.question: Regarding the management of a normal pregnancy (Mrs. Kokigoyoo at 29 weeks): Select appropriate care. (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Standard ANC package: Assess, Test, Prevent, Teach.

questions.question: Arrange the steps of Lovset's Maneuver for breech delivery with extended arms:

items.text: Allow buttocks to deliver spontaneously to umbilicus
Rotate 180 degrees to bring posterior arm anterior
Rotate back 180 degrees to deliver second arm

questions.explanation: Lovset's uses rotation to lower the posterior arm under the pubic arch.
